<DOMAIN>CONSTRUCTION</DOMAIN>
<RESUME_START>
CONSTRUCTION AND DESIGN PROJECT MANAGER

SUMMARY

Seasoned Design and Construction Project Manager with more than 13 years' experience in managing multimillion
projects in the US and abroad. Expertise in coordinating and overseeing all aspects of design and construction, from
conceptualization to completion, while providing continuous status reports to business owners and investors. Proven
track record of achieving construction goals and consistently completing projects on time and budget. Fluency in
English and Italian with working knowledge of Spanish and French. Seeking to leverage success and experience to take
next career step in a challenging project management position with a respected institution in Connecticut.

SKILLS

Sage Timberline Software, Compeat, QuickBooks, Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Access)

EXPERIENCE

Construction and Design Project Manager

10/2002 to Current
Company Name
City ,
State
Oversee all facets of project management for several multimillion-dollar restaurant and residential projects in
New York City and London, including contract negotiations and administration, project estimation, material
purchasing, budget management, and site management; managed design and construction for 10 projects to
date. Coordinate with owner and investors during pre-construction phase to develop requirements, scopes of work, and
budgets; execute and manage budget and schedules from conception to completion. Organize trades, procure source materials, and liaise between owner, principal architect, designers, engineers,
subcontractors, and vendors.
Partner with architects to solicit bids for construction and design, assess bids, and award contracts.
Manage selection and hiring of design and construction subcontractors, and work with both teams to achieve
milestones on time and on budget. Document observations and photograph ongoing design and construction work, produce field reports, and
regularly communicate project status to internal partners weekly. Investigate issues and expedite resolution to maintain timelines and budgets; develop strategies to prevent
recurrence of issues. Research and commission artisans to build site specific and custom objects for interior and exterior design and
décor. Source and purchase materials from international vendors, and purchase and coordinate material shipments from
vendors to construction sites. Ensure compliance with requisite regulations, including federal, state, and local building codes and safety
guidelines.
Past experience includes Education Program Coordinator at Solomon R.
Guggenheim Museum, Office
Manager at Cranmer Art Conservation, Inc., and Assistant Program Manager at Trinity College.

EDUCATION AND TRAINING

Bachelor of Arts :
Museum Studies and Art History Art History Italian
The City College of New York
City ,
State
Museum Studies and Art History Art History Italian
The University of Vermont
City ,
State
Dean's List

CERTIFICATIONS

Design and Construction
Budget Development and Management
Project Management
Requests for Proposal and Estimation
Contract Negotiations and Administration
Sourcing and Procurement

SKILLS

architect, Art, budget management, Budget Development and Management, budgets, budget, building codes, Contract Negotiations, contracts, Design and Construction, hiring, materials, Access, Excel, Microsoft Office Suite, Outlook, PowerPoint, Word, Office
Manager, Procurement, Project Management, Proposal, purchasing, QuickBooks, Research, safety, Sage, Solomon, Timberline
<RESUME_END>

<JD_START>
Job Title: Project Manager

Location: Orlando, FL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Administrative, Other, Project Management

Description:
Title: Project Manager – Mechanical Commercial Construction and HVAC Location: Orlando, FL Company Overview:Our client is a leading provider of mechanical commercial construction and HVAC solutions, dedicated to delivering excellence in every project. With a strong commitment to innovation, quality, and client satisfaction, we specialize in both small and large-scale commercial construction ventures ranging from $5000 to $20 million in project size. Our team thrives on collaboration, integrity, and exceeding expectations. Job Description:As a Project Manager, you will play a pivotal role in overseeing and managing our client’s mechanical construction, commercial construction and HVAC projects. We are seeking an experienced professional who is passionate about delivering high-quality results within budget and on schedule. If you have a proven track record of success in project management, experience in the commercial construction and HVAC industry, and proficiency in Procore and Bluebeam software, we want to hear from you. Responsibilities:Lead and manage mechanical construction, commercial construction and HVAC projects from inception to completion, ensuring adherence to timelines, budgets, and quality standards.Collaborate with internal teams, subcontractors, suppliers, and clients to facilitate seamless project execution and communication.Develop and maintain project schedules, budgets, and resources allocation plans.Conduct regular site visits and inspections to monitor progress, identify potential issues, and implement corrective actions as needed.Manage project documentation, including contracts, drawings, change orders, RFIs, and submittals using Procore and Bluebeam software.Oversee procurement processes, including sourcing materials, negotiating contracts, and managing vendor relationships.Ensure compliance with all regulatory requirements, safety standards, and industry best practices.Provide leadership, guidance, and support to project teams, fostering a positive work environment and culture of accountability.Communicate project status, updates, and milestones to stakeholders, addressing any concerns or inquiries in a timely and professional manner.Proactively identify opportunities for process improvement, innovation, and cost-saving initiatives.Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Construction Management, Engineering, or related field.Minimum of 5 years of experience in project management within the mechanical construction, commercial construction or HVAC industry.Primavera is a plusProven track record of successfully managing small and large-scale commercial projects ranging from $5000 to $20 million in project size.Proficiency in Procore and Bluebeam software for project management and document control.Strong leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.Excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.Ability to multitask, prioritize workload, and thrive in a fast-paced environment.Knowledge of construction methods, materials, and building codes.

Experience Level (if available): Associate
<JD_END>
